tools.name: CreateContact
tools.description:
Create a new contact record in Google Contacts.

Examples:
```
create_contact(given_name="Alice")
create_contact(given_name="Alice", family_name="Smith")
create_contact(given_name="Alice", email="alice@example.com")
```

parameters.name: given_name
parameters.description: The given name of the contact

parameters.name: family_name
parameters.description: The optional family name of the contact

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The optional email address of the contact

output.description: A dictionary containing the details of the created contact

tools.name: CreateSpreadsheet
tools.description:
Create a new spreadsheet with the provided title and data in its first sheet

Returns the newly created spreadsheet's id and title

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the new spreadsheet

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to write to the spreadsheet. A JSON string (property names enclosed in double quotes) representing a dictionary that maps row numbers to dictionaries that map column letters to cell values. For example, data[23]['C'] would be the value of the cell in row 23, column C. Type hint: dict[int, dict[str, Union[int, float, str, bool]]]

output.description: The created spreadsheet's id and title

tools.name: FindTimeSlotsWhenEveryoneIsFree
tools.description: Provides time slots when everyone is free within a given date range and time boundaries.

parameters.name: email_addresses
parameters.description: The list of email addresses from people in the same organization domain (apart from the currently logged in user) to search for free time slots. Defaults to None, which will return free time slots for the current user only.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date to search for time slots in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Defaults to today's date. It will search starting from this date at the time 00:00:00.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date to search for time slots in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Defaults to seven days from the start date. It will search until this date at the time 23:59:59.

parameters.name: start_time_boundary
parameters.description: Will return free slots in any given day starting from this time in the format 'HH:MM'. Defaults to '08:00', which is a usual business hour start time.

parameters.name: end_time_boundary
parameters.description: Will return free slots in any given day until this time in the format 'HH:MM'. Defaults to '18:00', which is a usual business hour end time.

output.description: A dictionary with the free slots and the timezone in which time slots are represented.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GenerateGoogleFilePickerUrl
tools.description:
Generate a Google File Picker URL for user-driven file selection and authorization.

This tool generates a URL that directs the end-user to a Google File Picker interface where
where they can select or upload Google Drive files. Users can grant permission to access their
Drive files, providing a secure and authorized way to interact with their files.

This is particularly useful when prior tools (e.g., those accessing or modifying
Google Docs, Google Sheets, etc.) encountered failures due to file non-existence
(Requested entity was not found) or permission errors. Once the user completes the file
picker flow, the prior tool can be retried.

output.description: Google File Picker URL for user file selection and permission granting

tools.name: GetFileTreeStructure
tools.description: Get the file/folder tree structure of the user's Google Drive.

parameters.name: include_shared_drives
parameters.description: Whether to include shared drives in the file tree structure. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: restrict_to_shared_drive_id
parameters.description: If provided, only include files from this shared drive in the file tree structure. Defaults to None, which will include files and folders from all drives.

parameters.name: include_organization_domain_documents
parameters.description: Whether to include documents from the organization's domain. This is applicable to admin users who have permissions to view organization-wide documents in a Google Workspace account. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sort order. Defaults to listing the most recently modified documents first

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of files and folders to list. Defaults to None, which will list all files and folders.

output.description: A dictionary containing the file/folder tree structure in the user's Google Drive

tools.name: ListEvents
tools.description:
List events from the specified calendar within the given datetime range.

min_end_datetime serves as the lower bound (exclusive) for an event's end time.
max_start_datetime serves as the upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time.

For example:
If min_end_datetime is set to 2024-09-15T09:00:00 and max_start_datetime
is set to 2024-09-16T17:00:00, the function will return events that:
1. End after 09:00 on September 15, 2024 (exclusive)
2. Start before 17:00 on September 16, 2024 (exclusive)
This means an event starting at 08:00 on September 15 and
ending at 10:00 on September 15 would be included, but an
event starting at 17:00 on September 16 would not be included.

parameters.name: min_end_datetime
parameters.description: Filter by events that end on or after this datetime in ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2024-09-15T09:00:00'.

parameters.name: max_start_datetime
parameters.description: Filter by events that start before this datetime in ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2024-09-16T17:00:00'.

parameters.name: calendar_id
parameters.description: The ID of the calendar to list events from

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of events to return

output.description: A dictionary containing the list of events

tools.name: SearchAndRetrieveDocuments
tools.description:
Searches for documents in the user's Google Drive and returns a list of documents (with text
content) matching the search criteria. Excludes documents that are in the trash.

Note: use this tool only when the user prompt requires the documents' content. If the user only
needs a list of documents, use the `search_documents` tool instead.

parameters.name: return_format
parameters.description: The format of the document to return. Defaults to Markdown.

parameters.name: document_contains
parameters.description: Keywords or phrases that must be in the document title or body. Provide a list of keywords or phrases if needed.

parameters.name: document_not_contains
parameters.description: Keywords or phrases that must NOT be in the document title or body. Provide a list of keywords or phrases if needed.

parameters.name: search_only_in_shared_drive_id
parameters.description: The ID of the shared drive to restrict the search to. If provided, the search will only return documents from this drive. Defaults to None, which searches across all drives.

parameters.name: include_shared_drives
parameters.description: Whether to include documents from shared drives. Defaults to False (searches only in the user's 'My Drive').

parameters.name: include_organization_domain_documents
parameters.description: Whether to include documents from the organization's domain. This is applicable to admin users who have permissions to view organization-wide documents in a Google Workspace account. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sort order. Defaults to listing the most recently modified documents first

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of documents to list

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: The pagination token to continue a previous request

output.description: A dictionary containing 'documents_count' (number of documents returned) and 'documents' (a list of documents with their content).

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

parameters.name: search_only_in_shared_drive_id

parameters.name: include_shared_drives

parameters.name: include_organization_domain_documents

parameters.description: The number of documents to list

tools.name: UpdateEvent
tools.description:
Update an existing event in the specified calendar with the provided details.
Only the provided fields will be updated; others will remain unchanged.

`updated_start_datetime` and `updated_end_datetime` are
independent and can be provided separately.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the event to update

parameters.name: updated_start_datetime
parameters.description: The updated datetime that the event starts in ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2024-12-31T15:30:00'.

parameters.name: updated_end_datetime
parameters.description: The updated datetime that the event ends in ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2024-12-31T17:30:00'.

parameters.name: updated_calendar_id
parameters.description: The updated ID of the calendar containing the event.

parameters.name: updated_summary
parameters.description: The updated title of the event

parameters.name: updated_description
parameters.description: The updated description of the event

parameters.name: updated_location
parameters.description: The updated location of the event

parameters.name: updated_visibility
parameters.description: The visibility of the event

parameters.name: attendee_emails_to_add
parameters.description: The list of attendee emails to add. Must be valid email addresses e.g., username@domain.com.

parameters.name: attendee_emails_to_remove
parameters.description: The list of attendee emails to remove. Must be valid email addresses e.g., username@domain.com.

parameters.name: send_updates
parameters.description: Should attendees be notified of the update? (none, all, external_only)

output.description: A string containing the updated event details, including the event ID, update timestamp, and a link to view the updated event.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

summary:
Arcade.dev provides tools for integrating with Google Workspace, enabling developers to automate tasks and enhance productivity through access to various Google services.

### Capabilities
- Manage calendar events, including creation, deletion, and updates.
- Access and manipulate Gmail functionalities, such as sending emails and organizing threads and labels.
- Interact with Google Drive for file management, including document creation and retrieval.
- Create and manage contacts within Google Contacts seamlessly.

### OAuth
Uses Google OAuth 2.0 for authentication, requiring the following scopes: 
- `https://www.googleapis.com/auth/calendar.events` 
- `https://www.googleapis.com/auth/contacts` 
- `https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.*`

### Secrets
No secrets are utilized in this toolkit.
